title: Where did Scriabin learn to write for an orchestra? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, for starters, some of his teachers were very good composers with a fine ear for the orchestra and even for combining chorus and orchestra (as Scriabin does in his 1st symphony and as teacher Sergei Taneev, for example, did in two cantatas, a substantial opera Oresteia (after the ancient classics), and other works. His other teachers included Nikolai Zverev, Vasily Safonov and Anton Arensky. Perhaps most importantly, according to “Scriabin, a biography”, he received occasional assistance and criticism from Rimsky-Korsakov as well.
